Â Depp is suing the NGN group after they published a 2018 article which branded him as a "wife-beater" â€“ a claim he denies. Â NGN's legal representation, Sasha Wass QC, asked the actor about the damage caused to the house, which occurred while he relocated down under to work on a Pirates of The Caribbean film. Â After an argument with his then-wife Heard, Depp admitted they left the house "wrecked".   Â MC Wass claimed there had been "five-figure sums" worth of damage done, with one of Depp's staff estimating the figure amounted to $150,000 (Â£120,000). Â The court heard that a member of Depp's team sent a message after the argument, which read: "I have got a lot of blood off the floor. I scrubbed the paint off.'' Â The floor also had to be sanded for restoration, and Depp's blood was discovered on two sofas. Â A window and a television, worth $15,000 (Â£12,000), were smashed in the process of the row.   Â When MC Wass asked Depp whether he remembered the window or TV breaking, he said he didn't. Â The actor confirmed there was "quite a lot of blood" but claimed his ex-wife was responsible for the damage, though he conceded he was "party" to the damage. Â Depp told the court: "She broke two bottles one of which took the tip off my finger." Â When asked about the bloodstains on the sofa, he replied: "That was me bleeding."  Â Depp was hospitalised after the row, but first, he scrawled notes on the mirror in his own blood and applied the blood to the lampshades and walls, the court heard. Â During the argument, Depp's finger was severed, which he claimed happened when Heard threw a vodka bottle in his direction. Â MC Wass alleged the argument concerned the couple's pre-nuptial agreement, which Depp confirmed, claiming Heard grew upset after discovering documentation regarding the agreement. Â Throughout the argument, there was shouting, screaming and the smashing of glass from the window, the court heard.  Â MC Wass also alleged that Depp urinated in the house before he was taken to hospital. Â The court heard that Heard claimed Depp had consumed a bottle of vodka, a bottle of Malbec wine, and 10 ecstasy pills. Â In a text he sent to his doctor in the aftermath, which was read to the court, he said Heard was "as full of s**t as a Christmas goose," calling her a "malicious, evil and vindictive c***". Â He continued: "She is so f*****g ambitious. That is probably why I was acquired, mate."

Â Depp, 57, is suing the tabloidâ€™s publisher News Group Newspapers (NGN) and its executive editor Dan Wootton over an April 2018 article branding the actor a "wife beater". Â King says he worked for the actor in October 2014 in London, 2015 in Australia and a year later in Vancouver, Canada. Â The estate manager said he was tasked with finding the star's severed finger. Â Depp claims that his finger was cut off during an altercation with his ex-wife Amber Heard, claiming she threw a vodka bottle at him during a trip to Australia.  Â The actor also claims he used his severed finger to write a bloody message on a mirror. Â In a previous statement, Heard claimed he'd hurt his hand while smashing a plastic phone against the wall repeatedly and she was not present at the time of the injury. Â King was shown the video, which was played on day one of the trial and again yesterday, of Depp kicking kitchen cupboards and pouring himself a pint of red wine for breakfast.  Â Asking about the actor's behaviour on the video Sasha Wass, QC for The Sun asked: "Did you ever see Mr Depp conduct himself like that during the time you worked for him?' Â Mr King answered he had not. Â King said he learned from the media that Depp lost his finger when a vodka bottle was allegedly thrown at him. Â Ms Wass asked: "You were not told at the house or at any time when you were working you were not told this explanation?"  Â King replied: "I don't recall being told that." Â Ms Wass said on March 8, 2015 the scene was "chaos" and the house was "wrecked", as Mr King agreed "it was not in a good state". Â Ms Wass said Mr King was tasked with finding Depp's severed digit, as King replied: "It wasn't my job but I was told it may be somewhere while I was cleaning up."  Â King was tasked with cleaning up the house after the row in which Heard claims Depp pushed her into a ping-pong table, choked her against a fridge and throttled her. Â Depp has admitted he wrote on a mirror in blood from his severed finger. Â Talking about cleaning up after a fight at their house in Australia, King said: "There was blood in the bar area. Â "There was a trail of blood up the stairs and then bloodspots in one bedroom mainly, but then a couple of other rooms."

Â Depp is suing the NGN group after they published a 2018 article which branded him as a "wife-beater" â€“ a claim he denies. Â NGN's legal representation, Sasha Wass QC, asked the actor about the damage caused to the house, which occurred while he relocated down under to work on a Pirates of The Caribbean film. Â After an argument with his then-wife Heard, Depp admitted they left the house "wrecked".  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles  Â MC Wass claimed there had been "five-figure sums" worth of damage done, with one of Depp's staff estimating the figure amounted to $150,000 (Â£120,000). Â The court heard that a member of Depp's team sent a message after the argument, which read: "I have got a lot of blood off the floor. I scrubbed the paint off.'' Â The floor also had to be sanded for restoration, and Depp's blood was discovered on two sofas. Â A window and a television, worth $15,000 (Â£12,000), were smashed in the process of the row.  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles  Â When MC Wass asked Depp whether he remembered the window or TV breaking, he said he didn't. Â The actor confirmed there was "quite a lot of blood" but claimed his ex-wife was responsible for the damage, though he conceded he was "party" to the damage. Â Depp told the court: "She broke two bottles one of which took the tip off my finger." Â When asked about the bloodstains on the sofa, he replied: "That was me bleeding."  Â Depp was hospitalised after the row, but first, he scrawled notes on the mirror in his own blood and applied the blood to the lampshades and walls, the court heard. Â During the argument, Depp's finger was severed, which he claimed happened when Heard threw a vodka bottle in his direction. Â MC Wass alleged the argument concerned the couple's pre-nuptial agreement, which Depp confirmed, claiming Heard grew upset after discovering documentation regarding the agreement. Â Throughout the argument, there was shouting, screaming and the smashing of glass from the window, the court heard.  Â MC Wass also alleged that Depp urinated in the house before he was taken to hospital. Â The court heard that Heard claimed Depp had consumed a bottle of vodka, a bottle of Malbec wine, and 10 ecstasy pills. Â In a text he sent to his doctor in the aftermath, which was read to the court, he said Heard was "as full of s**t as a Christmas goose," calling her a "malicious, evil and vindictive c***".
